website_summaries.verdict: Durable bag with a tie top to secure any mess.
pros: We love the absorbent pad that reduces odors
Customers cite these bags are a more comfortable alternative to a bucket or toilet bowl
Bags are also larger than one might expect
cons: May be a little tricky to hold in place when in motion

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I drive for Uber/Lyft on the weekends occasionally. While none of my passengers have ever needed them, my husband did on a long drive home after a wedding where he got food poisoning. The bags work perfectly. They didn't leak, the drawstrings kept the bags closed after they were used (we didn't really test this to see if we could hold it upside down or anything because that was just asking for trouble), and, best of all, I couldn't smell it. I couldn't believe this little bag was able to do that. I would definitely recommend these to anyone to keep on hand just in case of an emergency!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Sadly I bought these because I was throwing up frequently during my first trimester. These are a little pricey, but I stashed them in my car, work bag, and near my bed. I ended up buying a second box they were so convenient. I liked the absorbent that reduced messes in situations where I was driving and got really nauseous unexpectedly.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Don't leave home without these!
customer_reviews.text: These things are a LIFE SAVER! We use them in all of our cars... our 7 & 8 year old boys always seem to need them for either car sickness OR to do a quick pee-pee break... yes, we use them for that! They hold the liquid without any problems and they also have a large opening so the kiddos don't miss! Our road trips are a lot quicker mainly because we're not stopping every 30 minutes to use a rest room. Love these - never leave home without them!
customer_reviews.author: Estarr1218

customer_reviews.title: Essential for morning sickness!
customer_reviews.text: My wife was vomiting a lot for 10 weeks due to morning sickness. She went through two boxes of these. They were a lifesaver. These bags allowed her a much more sanitary and dignified way of doing what she had to. She appreciated it so much more than sticking her head in a toilet that may or may not be clean at any given moment. It was convenient and easy to keep in the car, purse, or on the nightstand. The strings allow for easy tying up. We never had a problem with messes/leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Xavier Alarcon

customer_reviews.title: Very inconspicuous! Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I have chronic nausea and vomiting due to digestive disorders and these fold up to look less like the blue emesis bags they have at the hospital. Plus they have the absorbent pad inside. You cannot tell what they are just by looking which makes me less embarrassed. So glad to have found them. They look like a padded mailer, not like an emesis bag.
customer_reviews.author: Beauty broken

customer_reviews.title: No Smell and Thick Layer
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t have chance to try this for long time. As it described it holds the smell. I think it’s because of the pad inside but still it’s not going to suck all puke so you should be careful otherwise it will spill around. But No smell at all and it’s thick not easy to leak
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: ... have had to use these twice now as an Uber driver and with 2 different people throwing up in ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had to use these twice now as an Uber driver and with 2 different people throwing up in my vehicle. Thank God I had them! It saved me so much hassle and cost of having to clean up their vomit. The bags are awesome...they were certainly big enough to hold everything and neither time did I ever smell anything. I would certainly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Tyson

customer_reviews.title: Ralph
customer_reviews.text: These are cloth inside plastic. They are about 2 inches wider than a standard sized iPad and about as tall. The drawstring on the top makes for a good smell seal and the absorbent pad is affixed inside so you don't have to worry about stopping to maneuver it. I put a few of these in the family ride for the kids - they tend to get sick in the car and this fits the bill perfectly! The opening is a good size for them and ensures all of the ralph is contained!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: excellent shape and slim profile - perfect for travel and every day carry
customer_reviews.text: excellent vomit absorption pad and liquid string tie closure system. this item has an outstanding overall size, shape, and slim storage profile. it’s perfectly designed for both indefinite travel and inconspicuous daily carry. these bags will comfortably fit into most small/medium sized daily carry bags - even a decent sized pant pocket or standard toiletry bag should be big enough to hold these bags. for even more flexibility, these bags and their internal membrane may fold onto themselves multiple times, potentially reducing their volume and changing shape without damaging the bag’s integrity, absorption ability, or capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew L Clinco

customer_reviews.title: Great for morning sickness!
customer_reviews.text: These bags are great!!! I bought them when I was in the middle of morning (all day) sickness with my pregnancy. I kept them in my car and purse so I'd have them on hand at all times. They came in very handy and although I was skeptical to pay this much when previously I'd just been using a grocery sack, I'd definitely buy these again. The liner helped absorb liquid and the ties are handy. I'm not confident they would keep the bag from leaking though, which is why I only have this 4 stars. Overall, it's a great product and I'd highly recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: BadaBeish

customer_reviews.title: Very useful for us...
customer_reviews.text: It's a strange thing to review, but sadly we have to use these nearly every day for my daughter so we have good experience so far. They are a good size and hold a fair bit of "volume." The cinch tie is a must. Grateful for that! I like that they're a little more opaque so you can't easily see the contents and my daughter is able to hold up to her mouth and keep under her chin easily. It does the trick and these have made outings much more tolerable. Simply use and toss!
customer_reviews.author: Bambios22

customer_reviews.title: Best invention ever
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my husband, who has gastroparesis. You never know when an "eruption" will happen, as they come without any hint of nausea feeling. These hold a lot, and the gel pad has it absorbed in about 2 min. I can keep several in my purse where ever we are. It takes 2 hands to hold without accidents, but that's OK. Those little blue bags take one hand, but everything runs out of them. The strings seal these bags well, and there's never any odor. We have been using them for 3 months now, and cannot say anything bad about them.
customer_reviews.author: Jean5099

customer_reviews.title: Hope I never know
customer_reviews.text: fortunately I can not review from live action. Hope I never will. But as a carshare driver, safety first. Sure looks like a better mousetrap. Nobody has been offended if asked if they are feeling sick and offer to help if anything comes up. part of my survival pack . Clients are welcome to take one with them.Who does not appreciate the dignity of a nice catch anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Carshare.TV

customer_reviews.title: These are the best ever! We have had to use these during ...
customer_reviews.text: These are the best ever! We have had to use these during chemo treatments and they have come in handy; at home, in the car, and at the hospital. The 'magic' pad in the bag is just that-magic- it's like having a diaper for your vomit. The bag really does control any odor and the double string tie really helps with not having a mess. The nurses at the hospital were even jealous of how cool these bags were and how well they worked! If you're looking for something to have for just in case accidents, morning sickness, or chemo treatments like us...these are the bags for you!
customer_reviews.author: TXmom

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids who get carsick!
customer_reviews.text: These have been a life saver for my family and I. My son gets car sick pretty much the moment he steps into a vehicle. He can hold the bag himself and the best part is we can close it up after he's finished. The absorbent pad is a godsend to ensure that its not leaking out until you get a chance to throw it out. Absolutely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Tamara

customer_reviews.title: No more cleaning vomit out of the car's back seat.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter get's car sick. I put these bags in the back seat. She can use them as needed and I no longer have to clean puke out of car. If you drive Uber, I'd suggest getting these if you are driving the drunks home. If they puke in your car, they get billed, you get a payout to cover the costs of cleaning, and all it costs you is a vomit bag.
customer_reviews.author: Tyson Purcell

customer_reviews.title: Easy Cleanup!
customer_reviews.text: Being a driver in Las Vegas, I've had someone vomit in my car more than once. I thought I could just carry plastic bags with me, but that wasn't working. I decided to give these a try after reading other reviews and am so glad that I did. These bags block any odor, as well as absorb any liquid.
customer_reviews.author: Salaam Smith

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old son gets car sick a lot. On a road trip I tried these out. He was able to hold the bag well and the bag not only held the contents perfectly but it kept the car from smelling. The top of the bag tied up nicely and held all in until we were able to stop and throw it away. We have a pouch on the back of the front car seat so my son was able to pull out bags as needed. I would recommend this product and will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Polacek

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for any household going through the pukes
customer_reviews.text: So convenient when my kid gets the pukeys. Whether in the car or in my luggage, I keep some folded up just in case. It easily fits on a small bucket and soaks up the nasty with no issues. We keep a box on hand and just ordered a new one to make sure we don't run out when someone gets sick again.
customer_reviews.author: Plat

customer_reviews.title: Happy to have it!
customer_reviews.text: My family has many troubles with car and airsickness. These flat bags are so easy to carry in a purse or even a pocket. They are very handy and they don't leak or smell once tied shut!
customer_reviews.author: Shari

customer_reviews.title: Not my preferred style of vomit bag
customer_reviews.text: I do not like this style. Especially difficult for an ill person to use. Definitely easy to store, though.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Great! If needed, will purchase again!
customer_reviews.text: These work great! I've been using them through my first trimester of pregnancy because I have to throw up all the time... they easily fold up and I can fit one into my purse to have when I go places. I also get carsick, and when I used one in the car, it had to sit for a while before we were able to stop and throw it away. It didn't smell up the car, in fact we couldn't smell it at all. I would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: EC

customer_reviews.title: Awesome puke bags
customer_reviews.text: These were awesome for when I was driving for Uber and Lyft! Small but mighty!
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: it is perfect for in-car use and use in a bathroom stall
customer_reviews.text: I have a medical condition called gastroparesis and I vomit on a daily basis after eating. This product has been a godsend. Unlike other emesis bags, there is no splash back because of the absorbent pad. Also, the absorbent pad masks odors of emesis and allows for much more volume than a typical bag. The ties are secure and the bag can be folded to fit into a pocketbook. I cannot say how many times I have found myself in a public place needing this product, it is perfect for in-car use and use in a bathroom stall. I struggle with the cost but it is well worth it for me because of the quality of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Marika Agnello

customer_reviews.title: Good Bag for Travel and Quick Use
customer_reviews.text: Good bag. I bought these bags for my sister who is suffering with nausea and vomiting from chemotherapy. They work well and are easy to carry in the car or purse to have available when needed. The material is very absorbent and limits any debris from coming out of the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Julikins

customer_reviews.title: Must Have for Uber Drivers
customer_reviews.text: This was one of my best purchases yet for my Uber / Lyft career. I have had three of them used already and everyone has hit in these large bags.side
customer_reviews.author: James Rizzo

customer_reviews.title: These are amazing for morning sickness
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for traveling with severe morning sickness. They worked beautifully for those unfortunate emergency type situations. I still carry a few in my car for when other passengers experience motion sickness as well.
customer_reviews.author: ALS

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done but,
customer_reviews.text: The absorbency pad in the bottom dries out before use.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Drunkards
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Purchased it because I drive for Uber/Lyft. Too many people who don't know how to say no to, too much liquor kept vomiting in my car. Now if only they wouldn't think the absorbent sheet wasn't just a paper towel.
customer_reviews.author: Tori

customer_reviews.title: Seems like they would work well
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to use these, but did feel them and they seem like they would do a really good job obsorbing the mess. We bought some other blue bags, and while they worked fine for us and we always had a gargabe can nearby to throwaway, I thougjt these would be nicer for car rides.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: So grateful for this nausea "safety net"
customer_reviews.text: Fist and second trimester lifesavers. I tucked them in my purse, car doors, center console, night stand drawer, and at work they were stashed everywhere and brought to meetings hidden in my folders, clipboards, pad folios, you name it...they came everywhere with me!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie K.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and handy bags.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality bags. Good to have this when you small kids at home. You can keep a bag in every room. Never know when you need them.
customer_reviews.author: Vivek

customer_reviews.title: Life-saving for people who are often sick in public!
customer_reviews.text: I take medication that unfortunately causes me to vomit frequently and without much warning. Not the most fun way to live your life, but these have really eased the burden of being in a vehicle or in public and needing to be sick. There seem to be 2 sets of strings at the top, which I haven't really figured out yet, but otherwise, the bags are a good size and the absorbent pad is great to minimize mess and disposal issues. I feel a lot more discreet and prepared when I go out now!
customer_reviews.author: Emily C

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for kids with motion sickness
customer_reviews.text: My kids (4 & 2) get motion sickness in the car, on the airplane, on the bus, and from spinning around in my dad's desk chair for too long. These bags have been lifesavers! There isn't a task I hate much more than cleaning up vomit, but with these bags all I have to do is cinch up the bag and throw it away. They really cut down the smell too. THANK YOU.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever!
customer_reviews.text: So glad we had these in the car. We've been using dramamine for our son but today we didnt give it to him soon enough for the trip. He got car sick and used the bag. Thank God because he just had fruit punch! It caught everything and didnt even smell once we closed it up. Life save for kids with motion sickness!
customer_reviews.author: jettysmom

customer_reviews.title: Great item for rideshare drivers
customer_reviews.text: If you’re a rideshare driver who drives on Saturday nights, get these. Stick two of them in your back car seat pocket for emergencies.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: An absolute must have especially is you are a ride share driver. They’re inexpensive and work like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my wife's birthday party. We ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife's birthday party. We had a 30 passenger party bus and trust me these were lifesavers on the bus.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Tate

customer_reviews.title: The best, Especially for chronically ill
customer_reviews.text: The best, Especially for chronically ill. Small and contract, easy and discreet. They truly turn the waste into a gel and leaves 100% no odor. You can put it in any trash with no issues. Thank goodness they make these! Days of holey shopping bags or bowls are over!
customer_reviews.author: Janet Gaides

customer_reviews.title: Good quality vomit bags
customer_reviews.text: These vomit bags are good for the intended purpose and so far it's been able to handle all kinds of vomit from my passengers.
customer_reviews.author: Almighty Pain

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect! Avoids spills as it does forms a gel
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect! Avoids spills as it does forms a gel! My son gets car sick and also has anxiety i just have to give him one of this and just knowing that he won't make a mess makes him feel way better!
customer_reviews.author: EPCab

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: bags work well for emergency situations while driving for Uber late at night in a college town.
customer_reviews.author: Isilwath

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Came in handy during the first trimester when I didn't know when I would start getting sick. Never leaked.
customer_reviews.author: Jeep 1

customer_reviews.title: Great for Uber drivers
customer_reviews.text: Great for Uber drivers. Big opening, good closing with the drawstrings, and they don't take up much room. A must have if you drive late at night during bar closing.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.

customer_reviews.title: These worked perfectly and are easy to store in the seat backs or in the ...
customer_reviews.text: We got these for a long road trip as we have carsick prone kiddos. These worked perfectly and are easy to store in the seat backs or in the glove box.console for easy access. They held contents well and the double draw string kept everything contained until we could reach a trash can. I will buy these again and recommend to anyone looking for a good solution for travel accidents.
customer_reviews.author: KatieP

customer_reviews.title: We got these to keep in the car in case ...
customer_reviews.text: We got these to keep in the car in case one of our children gets car sick. Luckily we haven't had to use a bag yet, but when the need arises, we will be prepared. The bags look well constructed, fold up flat for convenient storage in the glove compartment and appear to have enough absorbent material to do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Marisa

customer_reviews.title: and because it looked like they would meet our need the best
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for a family member who is having some issues currently with frequent emesis - throughout the day. I selected the Carebags because another reviewer raved about them, and because it looked like they would meet our need the best. The biggest reason for this is that they are needed on an ongoing basis for small amounts vs. large episodes, for the most part, and given the size, wonderful absorbent pad, and drawstring functionality, these bags are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Beth B. Sides

customer_reviews.title: Great for Uber/Lyft drivers
customer_reviews.text: Product works as it should and has stood the test of time.
customer_reviews.author: chamelionare

customer_reviews.title: Will NEVER stop buying this product!  A must have in our home & car!❤️
customer_reviews.text: Would not stop buying this product! We have it everywhere, in the bathroom, car, beside our bed, in the living room. I even carry one rolled up tightly with a rubber band in my purse!
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Pregnancy Lifesaver!!
customer_reviews.text: These were suggested by a friend and have been a complete lifesaver. I am currently suffering from extreme morning sickness and never leave the house without multiples. I keep them in my purse, car, diaper bag, etc. It beats having to puke in a public toilet (which is my worst nightmare). Will buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Choate

customer_reviews.title: Great care bags.
customer_reviews.text: These care bags are good quality. I have stomach issues and have found these bags to be perfect. I carry them in my purse, car and keep them handy in the restrooms.
customer_reviews.author: Kim C. Gealy

customer_reviews.title: No leak or smell
customer_reviews.text: Works great,It can hold a lot and does not leak or smell when full
customer_reviews.author: Zeshan

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for long car rides and kids
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful for long car rides and kids. Eventually our little one gets car sick, it only happens on long rides but sometimes pulling over is not possible (nighttime in the mountains). These bags will help you keep the sick secure and not on you or your ride. Work so much better than a regular plastic bags.
customer_reviews.author: R. Kraemer

customer_reviews.title: Helpful for Uber drivers to keep their cars neat and clean
customer_reviews.text: Helpful for Uber drivers to keep their cars neat and clean. Only have had one occasion where these were used. They work quite well.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I'm a Lyft driver and these are perfect for late nights.

customer_reviews.title: Good to have on hand
customer_reviews.text: Good for taking on trips if you need them. Being asthmatic with many coughing spells and a history of throwing up when coughing too much, comes in handy after doing it without something to catch it all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good bag
customer_reviews.text: I carry these everywhere I go due to a medical issue. They do not take up much space and hold quite a bit. Plus they don't look like a "regular" vomit bag.

customer_reviews.title: They are great to have
customer_reviews.text: They do as advertised, I get motion sickness every now and then. They are great to have around

customer_reviews.text: Got for drunk Uber riders... Now if I could only get them to grab one before vomiting.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best bag ever. It absorbs the liquid and it is easy to close.

customer_reviews.title: Road Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: Wife has used these plenty while pregnant. No odor afterward, no spillage, and no embarrassing side-of-the-road stops. Essential during pregnancy.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: These are the best
customer_reviews.text: These vomit bags are so easy to use. Our car sick prone 4 and 8 year old boys have successfully used these bags by themselves in the back row of a new car. These have been a lifesaver! 5 stars! EZ to use. Much better than trying to use a stolen barf bag from an airline!
customer_reviews.author: J. Grimes

customer_reviews.title: These are GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter gets carsick all the time. These are GREAT!

customer_reviews.text: I drive for Uber with a very convenient and made him take it with him and held up extremely well I'm very satisfied with this product

customer_reviews.text: I drive for Uber and Lyft and got these in preparation for the late night crowd. Fortunately, no one has needed one, but they are a great conversation starter with my riders.
customer_reviews.author: K. Faaborg

customer_reviews.title: Useful in messy situations
customer_reviews.text: Work well for the unfortunate purpose. Great absorption of liquid by the bottom pad.

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item to have in your car for a daughter who gets car sick easily. Especially for long road trips!

customer_reviews.title: which sucked. I prefer the blue emesis bags like the ...
customer_reviews.text: It managed to hold 6 cups of water and turn it into gel during my experiments, however it is a hassle to hold when actually throwing up I find I need both hands or I spill it on the floor, which sucked. I prefer the blue emesis bags like the ones at the hospitals- only require one hand and ive never spilled it and you can find them on amazon if you look.
customer_reviews.author: A D Graham

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Absorbs liquid and when tied up does not let the smell out at all.
customer_reviews.author: SuzyQ

customer_reviews.title: They are also perfect in the car
customer_reviews.text: This is one product that delivers. I am in a wheelchair and found these bags to be very convenient to use for occasionally nausea. They are also perfect in the car. Much better than anything else available.

customer_reviews.title: Great bags
customer_reviews.text: Great bags. These are the only ones I'll order now.

customer_reviews.title: I drive for Lyft and these are awesome if you have someone sick in your car
customer_reviews.text: I drive for Lyft and these are awesome if you have someone sick in your car. Turns to gel so if it gets dropped liquid isn't going everywhere.

customer_reviews.text: I haven't needed one yet, but I am super glad I have them!

customer_reviews.text: These will work great. I'm a school bus driver and have put them all around my bus for students if they get sick. Haven't had to use them yet but they are there when needed.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Have not used but I am sure they are up to standard.
customer_reviews.author: Eedee

customer_reviews.title: Great for parents of children who get motion sickness
customer_reviews.text: No one likes the thought of having to buy vomit bags, but when my son started to develop car sickness, there wasn't any choice. These have worked very well for us. They have a very wide opening, which makes them easy for him to use, the absorbent pad in the bad seam to work well, and the draw string closes the bag tightly after use. Not a pleasant product, for sure, but a well put together one. If you have someone in the family that is prone to motion sickness, I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Bourbeau

customer_reviews.title: Essential Uber Driver purchase
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure how the bag was gonna hold up to a "chunkier" mess with a little more weight to it, but it worked out just fine... Well let's be honest I didn't do the honors, my drunk Uber Rider did. Great investment, quite happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Psychdlcrave

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: This product has been a God send! With a rough pregnancy, I have needed these quite often. I will keep buying them for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Leah Walker

customer_reviews.title: Sure beats the airline bags I have been using..
customer_reviews.text: A must-have for car rides with kids. You pop this out when you hear "Daddy, my tummy is upset" and you're safe.
customer_reviews.author: K. Keith

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These already came in handy once so far....What else can I say? They work!

customer_reviews.title: We used two bags already and they worked GREAT! I AM SO GLAD WE GOT IT
customer_reviews.text: I have a daughter, who commonly gets carsick and tends to vomit. It is a nightmare to deal with! We used two bags already and they worked GREAT! I AM SO GLAD WE GOT IT!!!! I will be ordering more.

customer_reviews.title: These bags are AMAZING!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a medical issue and these bags came in a handy more than once. They are simple to use and very discreet...they don’t look like regular vomit bags. The absorbent pad inside never failed me, it absorbs everything and catches the odors pretty well. I highly recommend this product, it is a life saver!
customer_reviews.author: Rosco

customer_reviews.title: Very useful for us LYFT drivers...
customer_reviews.text: In the last hours these can come in very handy for those passengers that might have had a few too many.
customer_reviews.author: oldrnwhyzer1

customer_reviews.title: I haven't had to use them yet for my UBER riders but they appear to be of good quality
customer_reviews.text: Luckily, I haven't had to use them yet for my UBER riders but they appear to be of good quality. I like the size and the drawstring closure feature.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Bags appear to be as expected. I have not ...
customer_reviews.text: Bags appear to be as expected. I have not had to actually use one, but they look to be of adequate quality and I am sure will get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Easy and convenient to keep in car or to keep ...
customer_reviews.text: I don’t travel with out these! Easy and convenient to keep in car or to keep in carry-on! Just ordered my 2nd box!
customer_reviews.author: Cathey

customer_reviews.title: Must have for Lyft or Uber
customer_reviews.text: If you drive with Uber or Lyft, you absolutely want to keep a few of these in your car for those unexpected moments! The bags are a lot more cost-effective than the downtime and mess in your car.
customer_reviews.author: alekster

customer_reviews.title: The bags have worked great. Very useful in the car as well
customer_reviews.text: The bags have worked great. Very useful in the car as well, if someone happens to get sick while driving. Don't have to worry about spills or leaks like you would with typical bags.
customer_reviews.author: Joy o

customer_reviews.title: really helpful, convenient and easy to hide in purse
customer_reviews.text: going through chemo is not fun... these make the experience a lot easier. it reduces anxiety to know i have these at hand if i ever need them, and because they fold flat it's easy to keep one in my purse at all times.
customer_reviews.author: sarah4

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: We give these to our volunteers who drive patients to see a medical specialist. Sometimes their medication causes nausea.
customer_reviews.author: NM Religious Coalition for Reproductive Choice

customer_reviews.title: Great product. I keep these in the car
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I keep these in the car, in the airplane and in my flight bag for occasions where I have someone with me that feels bad. The clean and effective bag and closer is great.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: this is a great compact product to take with me in those cases
customer_reviews.text: I suffer from migraines and nausea, this is a great compact product to take with me in those cases , I can't get somewhere to before vomiting. It about the right size , with absorbent pad included.
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: car sickness
customer_reviews.text: Car sickness is no longer the problem it once was with these on hand
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for traveling with m uhh cancer kid in the car!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn B.

customer_reviews.title: ... had to use them on someone else but I like the compactness
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used them yet or had to use them on someone else but I like the compactness.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These bags are great. I keep them in my uber car at all times!
customer_reviews.author: Wade McConnelee

product_meta.title: Carebag Vomit Bag with Super Absorbent Pad (Box of 20 Bags)
product_meta.description:
Size:1 Box of 20 linersHow far is the restroom when you get that sudden 'I feel sick' sensation? Don’t worry about it anymore! The Medical Grade Carebag Vomit Bag from Cleanis will effectively catch and contain all vomit mess and spare you the trouble of cleaning up your clothes, car, carpet or floor! Our Carebag Vomit Bag is a medical grade bag equipped with a unique super absorbent pad, which turns up to 16oz of emesis into a gel within seconds. It is designed for both children and adults, and it is the ideal solution for people subject to motion sickness, morning sickness, vertigo, post-surgery, chemotherapy, etc. The Carebag Vomit Bag is great for family trips and is a must have for people in the business of car service!

Keep One With You at All Times! 
Thank you for helping others
One of Cleanis' many missions is to empower people with physical, developmental, intellectual and mental health challenges to enjoy lives of dignity and purpose. The product you are currently considering has been processed at the Association for Individual Development (AID), a vocational facility in Aurora, Illinois by individuals with disabilities. The goal is to provide a safe and nurturing environment so that each participant can learn and obtain new skills at their own pace. We would like to thank you in advance for helping individuals with disabilities grow and improve their level of confidence and personal satisfaction for a paid job well done.
feature_bullets: 𝗡𝗘𝗩𝗘𝗥 𝗖𝗟𝗘𝗔𝗡 𝗩𝗢𝗠𝗜𝗧 𝗔𝗚𝗔𝗜𝗡 - Use it for emergencies, then simply throw away your disposable bag like a trash bag!
𝗡𝗢 𝗦𝗣𝗜𝗟𝗟𝗦 𝗢𝗥 𝗟𝗘𝗔𝗞𝗦 - Unlike a paper bag, the leak proof bag contains a super absorbent pad that absorbs up to 16oz of liquid within seconds
𝗖𝗔𝗥𝗥𝗬 𝗜𝗧 𝗔𝗡𝗬𝗪𝗛𝗘𝗥𝗘 – Thanks to its small size, it can fit in your bag or your car for emergencies
𝗡𝗢 𝗠𝗢𝗥𝗘 𝗡𝗔𝗦𝗧𝗬 𝗦𝗠𝗘𝗟𝗟 - The pad and sealable bag prevent odor from spreading in the air.
𝗧𝗛𝗘 𝗢𝗡𝗟𝗬 𝗦𝗢𝗟𝗨𝗧𝗜𝗢𝗡 for the collection and confinement of dangerous pathogens: Coronavirus COVID-19, Clostridium Difficile, MRSA
